channel.title: Works on Graham Holker
channel.description: Recent content in Works on Graham Holker

item.title: Machine Intelligence Engineer @ ROSS Intelligence
item.description: Things I have worked on: Rebuilt data pipeline for improved data integrity Improved search results using a citation graph Creative use of public domain data to generate data set Optimized search relevance for statutes and regulations

item.title: Software Engineer @ Helpful
item.description: I joined as the 3rd engineer and touched most of the stack. Helpful started as a company directory app using AI and ML to help find people and later became a video messaging app. Things I worked on: Built solution for real-time speech recognition end-to-end from mobile clients to backend services to speech-to-text APIs Ideated and built a video editor based on the transcribed audio Designed search indices and optimized relevance (ElasticSearch) Implemented a paper to extract professional skills from text that included use of PageRank algorithm Developed a “person vector” model based on word vectors of Slack data that could find similar users using nearest neighbours search Developed Android app for recording and watching videos Helpful was acquired by Shopify.

item.title: Android Specialist @ Freelance
item.description: Projects included: Android game with 10M+ installs New app for Canadian telecom

item.title: Engineering Manager @ Pivotal
item.description: Built and lead the development of applications for clients.

item.title: Lead Engineer @ Xtreme Labs
item.description: Built and lead the development of Android applications for clients. Xtreme Labs was acquired by Pivotal in 2013.

item.title: Image stitching software for BublCam
item.description: Developed panorama image stitching algorithm to match camera specifications Implemented stitching in C and viewer with OpenGL The Kickstarter pitch is still available although the company’s site is now gone (as of 2019-09-08).

item.title: Graduate Student in Machine Learning
item.description: Thesis: Neuroevolution using a probabilistic model of neural networks Thesis Source (C/C++) Course project: Knowledge Based System for the design of inductors Source

item.title: Web Application Developer @ Cyence
item.description: Stack: C# .NET Cyence was later acquired by Davis & Henderson.

item.title: RFID Specialist @ IBM
item.description: My first job out of University. Working as an RFID Specialist. The only one in Canada.
